data.title: Unpretentious but very good
data.text: Located in downtown Cedar Rapids my wife and I finally decided to stop by after seeing it for years across from another of our favorites, "The White Star".  We were not disappointed.  The prices are very reasonable and food excellent in both quantity and quality.  Mix the hot and spicy sauces together if you dare.  Quite an experience.

data.title: Get lost with the Cuban!!
data.text: Amazing!! Superb!! So many one words to describe a delicious satisfying sandwich!  I had the Cuban sandwich and the tres leches cake.  The Cuban was well prepared and hit the spot.  The desert seemed a bit dry and not as fulfilling and creamy like a tres leches should be.  This is certainly a 5 star joint, with great tasting Cubans and awesome customer service! Way to keep this place hopping! Now, I know people out there will have had better Cubans elsewhere. But in Cedar Rapids, IA, the Cuban is certainly lost here!

data.title: The coffee is amazing
data.text:
The plantains and the Cuban sandwich were good. The ground beef, olives, beans and  rice thing was loved by everyone else. Grand girl loved the empanada. 
Biggest issue there is that they only have high top seating. Not handicapped friendly.

data.title: Usually very good food
data.text: The quality of the food varies a little, but it's never bad and is usually very good. It's the only restaurant of its kind, serving Cuban dishes like arroz con pollo. It's downtown, so it's not entirely easy to access unless you're already parked. The seating is all high chairs, which I'm not a fan of, and it's hard to find a seat during the lunch peak. The food is tasty enough that I make it a point to go despite these challenges every couple of months. My favorite dish is lechon asado, but anything under Main Dishes is great. I haven't tried their sandwiches.

data.title: The benchmark Cuban sandwich
data.text: The menu is somewhat limited, but really honest and authentic. I have had a number of Cuban sandwiches, many of them too "fancied up" or re-thought. This sandwich is just right. They also make killer ribs, not always available and going quickly when they are. Their location makes them a good cycling destination if you are in the downtown area.

data.title: Lil Cuban Diner
data.text:
I had Googled the restaurant online to check the hours then called about reservations but they don't except them.I read a few reviews prior to our dining experience there which helped us be prepared and not disappointed.  We arrived on a Friday evening about 7:10 earliest we could all assemble The Lost Cuban closes at 8 so we knew we would need to be prompt with our orders as we were a party of 7. We were greeted upon entry the gentleman told us we order at counter and they bring it out.
He informed us they were out of Chicken from a dinner rush, bummer normally that's what I'd order but no biggie I like all types of meat.
We ended up ordering Cubans , Pork Dish Beef Dish,Veggie Dish ,Yucca as an appetizer and one side of Plantains we all shared taste of each dish . The two gentlemen working did a great job with taking our orders, preparing and serving our food and everyone enjoyed their dishes .
The portions where huge, BONUS  the Mojito was great tasting too. My advise for a good visit go in mentally prepared it's Fast Food with a cuban menu, a diner with disposable plates ,cups and silverware and your partially waiting on yourself .
So if your looking for an experience beyond your taste buds more than likely you'll be disappointed but if your looking for some  Cuban Food in Iowa .....ENJOY  !

data.title: Edible, but not impressed
data.text: The Lost Cuban is a small restaurant downtown Cedar Rapids.  There are maybe a dozen tables inside, all with bar-height stools (I.e. not kid-friendly).  The atmosphere was a little wanting and almost appeared like they gave up half way through decorating.  The kitchen is mostly exposed to the dining room and looked disorganized and border-line dirty.  The staff were wearing street clothes and did not look professional.  The girl in the kitchen had on super short shorts.  The menu is very small.  They were out of cheese at 12:30 pm.  The Cuban sandwich I ordered was good, but not great and took about 20 minutes to get.  Plan for an extra 20 minutes to find parking before you eat.

data.title: A Cedar Rapids Favorite
data.text: I have been going to The Lost Cuban for a couple of years now with friends, family, co-workers.  It's a favorite lunch destination. The Cuban and Arroz con Pollo are my personal favorites, and don't forget the dulce de fuego salsa, it's nothing less than amazing!!  The place is always packed at lunch time, but they're quick.  The Lost Cuban is a must-try if you're near Cedar Rapids!

data.title: A Cuban Restaurant in Iowa???
data.text:
Great place. Reminds me of being back in Miami. Chicken and yellow rice was great. Black beans were seasoned perfectly.  And the Tres Lechie was to die for!  This is authentic Cuban food passed down from the owners Abuela (that's grandmother for you non-Spanish speaking folks).  How do I know this? Well, in the interest of full disclosure, I am family. But the review is truly honest. Just look at the reviews on this and other sites! 

If you find yourself in Cedar Rapids, Iowa (or within a short drive) you owe it to yourself to go. You will not be disappointed.

data.title: We don't go here anymore
data.text: Third strike out rule. Long wait, poor quality food too this option off the staff lunch list. I suggest you get your ducks in a row before everyone drives out of downtown for lunch.

data.title: Always busy!
data.text: This is the real thing, only somewhat tempered for midwestern taste.  Cuban food for lunch in downtown Cedar Rapids!  What's not to like?  Not open for dinner, sadly.

data.title: Great Cuban Food can be Found in the Midwest
data.text: I have been driving the 30 minutes to Cedar Rapids to dine at this wonderful restaurant for 2 years.  I have never been disappointed in anything that I have ordered and I believe that I have tried everything on the menu except the sandwiches.  If you can go on Thursday for the Cuban ribs--do so--they are wonderful.  I almost always order a side of plantains because I can't choose between them and the black beans.  Do check the hours in advance, they are a bit odd.

data.title: Food is great..... overall needs fine tuning
data.text:
We went here for lunch after our friend told us about it, and he was right, in that the food is very good.

While the food was very good, they could use some fine tuning.  They were out of yuca, the pop dispenser did not work (drinks were poured our of 2 liter bottles), and seating at the four person tables was a little tight.

Organizationally they seemed just a little bit off but the food is the main reason for coming here so you can overlook those issues.

data.title: Generous servings, Friendly staff
data.text: The day I visited, The Lost Cuban was out of bread--completely sold out. No sandwiches available, so I had a veggie meal. Enjoyable, but more than the food--the staff made you feel special for eating there.  I'll go back.

data.title: Great traditional Cuban fare.
data.text: Tastes like one of the smaller Cuban places in Florida, very authentic. Be warned though, this place has WILD hours, expect them to be open pretty much during the work day only. They are open a bit later on the weekends, but don't expect a Cuban sandwich to accompany your drinks when you're out at night with friends or family. Minus 1 star for not having croquetas.

data.title: Always Incredible...
data.text: Like always, the Ropa Vieja and Lechon Asado are so delicious you literally lose self control and eat the entire, very generous portion. The staff is friendly and will customize whatever you want. By far the best latin ethnic cuisine in Cedar Rapids and maybe in all Eastern Iowa. Not my first time here with my wife, and it certainly wont be the last!!

data.title: Play Dominos while you eat
data.text: Loving different ethnic foods, The Lost Cuban sounded like someplace we just had to try.   We were in Cedar Rapids on a Saturday night.  The restaurant is downtown which is pretty quiet at that time.  Parking is at meters, free at night, on the street.  Lost Cuban is a smallish place.  Not quite what I expected.   You walk up to a counter and order your food which they then bring to you. There were about 10 or so high top tables.  They had sets of dominos on the counter which you could use to while your time away waiting for your food, not that the wait was exceptionally long. They serve  beer and alcohol, too.  We had  the picadillo which is beef with black beans and the arroz con polo with black beans.   I wanted the maduros but that was one of 2 or 3 sides that they were out of.  The bean were nicely seasoned and picadillo and arroz con pollo were very tasty.  If ever in Cedar Rapids we would stop here again.

data.title: Yummy
data.text: Check it out. The food is very good and spicy. Staff is friendly and helpful. We would definitely come back to try other menu items.

data.title: Best Cuban food around these parts
data.text: OK,  not Ybor City quality, but this is Cedar Rapids and if you are in need of your Cuban fix for grun, then this is certainly the place to go.  It has all of the basics that anyone would want and will leave satisfied.  cost is very reasonable and well worth the visit.

data.title: Pretty good
data.text: Great service. Easy to find. Generous portions. Wish they had plantains that day. Sweet sauce is tasty.
